intro: Ranunculus quinatus, commonly known as the five-leaved buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are palmately divided into five lobes. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The species is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
